text: The King's Speech is a 2010 British historical drama movie. It is set in the 1930s. It was directed by Tom Hooper and written by David Seidler. Colin Firth plays King George VI who, to overcome his stammer, sees Lionel Logue. Logue is an Australian speech therapist played by Geoffrey Rush. The two men become friends as they work together. After his brother, Edward VIII, abdicates, the new king relies on Logue to help him make a radio broadcast at the beginning of World War II. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:2010 buddy movies Category:2010 drama movies Category:Academy Award winning movies Category:BAFTA Award winning movies Category:British buddy movies Category:2010s British drama movies Category:Monarchy of the United Kingdom Category:Buddy drama movies Category:English-language movies Category:2010s historical movies Category:Movies set in London Category:Movies set in Scotland Category:Movies set in the 1920s Category:Movies set in the 1930s Category:Screen Actors Guild Award winners Category:Movies directed by Tom Hooper
